alert.note: Alert for Cuyama Valley; San Luis Obispo County Beaches; San Luis Obispo County Inland Central Coast; San Luis Obispo County Interior Valleys; San Luis Obispo County Mountains; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Lucia Mountains; Southern Salinas Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 8:39PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Santa Barbara and southeastern San Luis Obispo Counties through 915 PM PDT... At 837 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms from 6 miles west of McKittrick to near Arroyo Grande. Movement was west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail, along with brief heavy downpours and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Luis Obispo, Pismo Beach, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Oceano, Carrizo Plain, Avila Beach, Highway 166 between Twitchell Dam and the Cuyama Valley, Shell Beach, Lake Lopez, Baywood-Los Osos, and Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
